alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 6:27AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Clarendon, south central Sumter and east central Orangeburg Counties through 700 AM EDT... At 626 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Summerton to 9 miles southeast of Santee State Park to near Dorchester. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45-50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Manning, Summerton, Alcolu, Santee Cooper Regional Airport, Eutawville, Paxville, St. Paul, Rocks Pond Campground and Marina, Foreston, Eautaw Springs, Indian Bluff Recreation Park, Gable, Davis Station and Blounts Landing. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 105 and 130. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
